title: Select Compositions & Programs of O. B. Gieger
content:
[[include theme:black-highlighter-theme]]
[[include :scp-wiki:theme:calamity]]

[[module css]]
@import url('https://fonts.googleapis.com/css?family=Love+Ya+Like+A+Sister|Mansalva|Permanent+Marker|Schoolbell|Caveat|Gloria+Hallelujah|Nanum+Brush+Script&display=swap');

:root {
 --header-title: "SCP Theatre";
 --header-subtitle: "Staged Community Productions";
}

div#extra-div-1 {
    background: url("https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/oboebandgeek99/unhuman-enby-left.png");
    background-size: contain;
    background-repeat: no-repeat;
    background-position: calc(50% - 10.5rem) 80%;
}
 
div#extra-div-2 {
    background: url("https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/oboebandgeek99/unhuman-enby-right.png");
    background-size: contain;
    background-repeat: no-repeat;
    background-position: calc(50% + 10.5rem) 80%;
}

@media only screen and (max-width: 1024px) {
 
    div#extra-div-1 {
      background-position: calc(50% - 6rem) 80%;
    }
 
    div#extra-div-2 {
      background-position: calc(50% + 6rem) 80%;
    }
}
[[/module]]

[[>]]
[[module Rate]]
[[/>]]

[[==]]
Welcome back to the collected works of the Staged Community Productions theatre company. Today, we offer you the works of that geeky band oboist, O. B. Gieger [[size 75%]](they/them)[[/size]].

[[size 115%]]**O. B. Gieger**[[/size]] is a playwright and composer. Despite their prolific work, it seems outside of the Staged Community Productions community they're best known for their contributions to others works, such as their compositional work on Carlisle Aktus' //[[[you-and-me |Track 4: You and Me]]]// (the chords to which can be found //[https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/oboebandgeek99/Track%204-You%20and%20Me%20chord%20chart.pdf here]//). Collected here are the programs and playbills of several of their works, including cast list and author's notes.
[[/==]]
[[toc title="Table of Contents"]]
[[=]]
+ One acts
These plays require no knowledge of outside work by the author and may be read without reading anything else by the author.
[[collapsible show="Click here to show Gieger's One-Acts" hide="Click here to hide Gieger's One-Acts"]]

----
+ Longer Works
While Gieger's one-act plays are fairly well known in their own right, many of Gieger's fans find satisfaction in reading their longer works, wherein Gieger ties together longer stories across multiple acts or even multiple works.
----
++ Schwarzwald
//One of Gieger's first attempts at a longer work, Schwarzwald is a grim retelling of the fairy tale "The Juniper Tree". Despite early bursts of motivation, the work remains unfinished, with only the first two acts ever surfacing, though rumors persist a finished (if unpolished) draft exists for the third act, even going so far as to claim that Gieger did begin Act 4.//

[[collapsible show="Click here to show Gieger's Schwarzwald works" hide="Click here to hide Gieger's Schwarzwald works"]]

**Starring:**
[[div style="float: left; width: 48%; text-align: right;"]]
**Flora Davis**
**David Vadas**
**The Songbird**
[[/div]]
[[div style="float: left; width: 4%; text-align: center;"]]
//as//
//as//
//as//
[[/div]]
[[div style="float: right; width: 48%; text-align: left;"]]
**The Green**
**The Wild**
**The Avenger**
[[/div]]

++++ [[[der-machandelbaum |Act 1: Der Machandelbaum]]]
++++ [[[verdure |Act 2: Verdure]]]
++++ Act 3: Fauna
++++ Act 4: The Gifts
++++ Act 5: Der Erdgeist
[[/collapsible]]
----
++ Self. Similar.
//A lesser known Gieger work, __Self. Similar.__ was co-written with Dr. Lake, seemingly as some sort of collaborative competition. While the work was released complete and as intended, Gieger has made no secret of their dissatisfaction with the work, as well as their desire to go back and change it.//
[[collapsible show="Click here to show Gieger's Self. Similar. works" hide="Click here to hide Gieger's Self. Similar. works"]]

++++ [[[richardson-island |Part 1: The Fractal Island]]]

----
++ Toejamcon
//The infamous "toe show" initially began as a joke by Gieger and friends, but quickly spiraled out of control when Gieger began crafting a narrative. Though generally well liked, fans and critics agree that the second act was the weakest of the bunch and the whole arc feels a little less than complete.//
[[collapsible show="Click here to show Gieger's Toejamcon works" hide="Click here to hide Gieger's Toejamcon works"]]

[[/collapsible]]
----
+ [[[unhuman-hub |UnHuman]]]
//Probably the largest impact Gieger has had on the Staged Community Production community is their creation of the world of __UnHuman__, a post apocalyptic setting wherein all normal humans died, leaving only anomalous ones. The world was so popular it inspired other writers to write for the series, something which Gieger enthusiastically approved of. Though only Gieger's UnHuman works are collected here, the writers of this website recommend reading UnHuman works by other authors as well.//
[[collapsible show="Click here to show Gieger's UnHuman works" hide="Click here to hide Gieger's UnHuman works"]]
----
++ Goodbye Nightflower
//__Goodbye Nightflower__ is the first of Gieger's UnHuman concepts, and a lot of the ideas that have made it into the world started from ideation with this story. Though much of Goodbye Nightflower remains unfinished, Gieger has teased this as one of their favorite works and assures audiences that work on Goodbye Nightflower continues even as other obligations come up.//
**Starring:**
[[div style="float: left; width: 48%; text-align: right;"]]
**Mio**
**Gabriella**
**Nitro**
**"Sebastian"**
[[/div]]
[[div style="float: left; width: 4%; text-align: center;"]]

//as//
//as//
[[/div]]

**The Explorer**
**The Chronicler**
**The Scavenger**
**The Loyal**
[[/div]]

+++++ Interlude 6 - ???
----
++ Molly on the Shore
//Though __Goodbye Nightflower__ was conceived first, __Molly on the Shore__ was completed quicker and remains the most popular UnHuman work by Gieger. Gieger has long teased a final chapter but claims that __Goodbye Nightflower__ must be completed first, and has hinted at the fact that the two story arcs are more connected than at first glance.//
**Starring:**
[[div style="float: left; width: 48%; text-align: right;"]]
**Molly ÅšlÄ…ski**
**Candela**
[[/div]]
[[div style="float: left; width: 4%; text-align: center;"]]
//as//
//as//
[[/div]]
[[div style="float: right; width: 48%; text-align: left;"]]
**The Siren**
**The Anchor**
[[/div]]
++++ [[[scp-5825 |Act 1: Molly on the Shore]]]
++++ [[[ship-to-wreck |Act 2: Ship to Wreck]]]
++++ [[[siren-song |Act 3: Siren Song]]]
----
++ [[[scp-6060 |Only Human]]]
//__Only Human__ has the distinction of being one of the only shows written collaboratively, this one being co-written with Dr. Mew after the two realized they'd come up with rather similar ideas for a writing competition. This story expands on the character of Candela, who is present to varying degrees in the other UnHuman works, but not to such an extent as presented in this tale, and none of her appearances were quite so revealing as this one.//
**Starring:**
[[div style="float: left; width: 48%; text-align: right;"]]
**River**
**Candela**
[[/div]]
[[div style="float: left; width: 4%; text-align: center;"]]
//as//
//as//
[[/div]]
[[div style="float: right; width: 48%; text-align: left;"]]
**The Reminiscent**
**The Human**
[[/div]]

[[/collapsible]]
----

+ Music
Though this page mostly consolidates the writings of OBG, it is a truth acknowledged by the playwright themselves that they are perhaps best known for their music. Collected here are the songs most relevant to the Staged Community Production, along with links to the works they're initially from.

+ Full List of works
Those wishing to find a more concise list of Gieger's work without cast listings and descriptions may wish to open the collapsible below. This list also shows the order in which the works were published as well as how popular said works are, as well as the latest published review.

----
+ Closing Remarks
[[/=]]
[[==]]
While the selected works here are the easiest to consolidate, other works by Gieger exist, and Gieger themself has indicated they have no plans to stop writing anytime soon. Much of Gieger's work has been shared online for free and they have repeatedly stated that the best way to support their work is simply read it and potentially share your thoughts in discussion spaces. If you would like a more direct way to financially support the playwright, the link below is a good place to start, but it should be reiterated that **financial contribution is NOT necessary to access the works of OBG.** We hope you will enjoy reading the works of O. B. Gieger and that you will continue to read the works of other contributors to the Staged Community Productions theatre company.
[[/==]]
